"Tony Hsieh, Zappos Luminary Who Revolutionized the Shoe Business, Dies at 46" Footwear News, November 27, 2020 was an American businessman and venture capitalist. He retired as the CEO of the online shoe and clothing company Zappos in August 2020. He became CEO in 1999. Hsieh co-founded the Internet advertising network LinkExchange, which he sold to Microsoft in 1998 for $265 million.Cf. Delivering Happiness book by Hsieh. "In 1996, I co-founded LinkExchange, which was sold to Microsoft in 1998 for $265 million." He was born in Illinois, but raised in San Francisco, California, and Las Vegas, Nevada. On November 18, 2020, Hsieh was injured in a house fire in New London, Connecticut, while visiting family for Thanksgiving. He was trapped in the basement during the fire. He died a week later on November 27 at a Bridgeport hospital from his injuries, aged 46. ==References== Category:1973 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American chief executives Category:Businesspeople from Illinois Category:Businesspeople from San Francisco Category:Businesspeople from Las Vegas Category:Deaths from fire Category:Accidental deaths in the United States Category:Writers from Illinois Category:Writers from Las Vegas
